intro: Conoclinium platylepis, commonly known as Mexican hummingbird vine, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It belongs to the family Aristolochiaceae and is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers. The plant produces clusters of small, fragrant blossoms that attract pollinators such as hummingbirds and bees. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. Conoclinium platylepis is often used in ornamental gardening for its vibrant floral display and ecological benefits.
